Header: Lebanese protesters wave flags, raise fortitude
Content: Lebanese protesters demanding the overthrow of their country’s elite poured onto the streets in the largest numbers since the government was toppled and hours after opposing supporters of President Michel Aoun staged a big rally. Prime Minister Saad al-Hariri resigned following unprecedented nationwide protests, deepening a political crisis and complicating efforts to enact badly needed economic reforms in Lebanon. Anti-government protesters flooded streets across the country, from Beirut to Tripoli, rejecting Aoun’s attempt to position himself as the guarantor of the protest movement and its anti-corruption drive.
